text: Manoranjan Dhar (21 February 1904 – 22 June 2000) was a Bangladeshi politician and diplomat. ==Early life== Dhar obtained his bachelor's from Calcutta University. He participated in the Non-cooperation movement in 1921. He took part in the Chittagong armoury raid in 1930. He was an editor of the weekly Gana-Abhijan during 1938–1940. ==Political career== Dhar was elected a member of the Bengal Legislative Council in 1946 and the East Bengal Legislative Assembly during 1947 – 1958. In 1972, he was appointed the Ambassador of Bangladesh to Japan. He was in charge of the Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs of Bangladesh on 16 March 1973. == Death == Dhar died on 22 June 2000. ==References== Category:1904 births Category:2000 deaths Category:University of Calcutta alumni Category:Awami League politicians Category:Ambassadors of Bangladesh to Japan Category:Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs ministers of Bangladesh
